Fudge Recipe For Diabetics

If you have diabetes, you may think that indulging in sweet treats like fudge is off-limits. However, with the right recipe and ingredients, you can still enjoy a delicious fudge that won't spike your blood sugar levels. Here's a fudge recipe specifically designed for diabetics.

Ingredients:

  • 1 cup unsweetened almond milk
  • 1 cup unsweetened cocoa powder
  • 1/2 cup natural peanut butter
  • 1/4 cup coconut oil
  • 1/4 cup sugar-free maple syrup
  • 1 teaspoon vanilla extract
  • 1/4 teaspoon salt
  • 1/4 cup chopped nuts (optional)

Instructions:

  1. In a saucepan, heat the almond milk over medium heat until it starts to simmer. Remove from heat and whisk in the cocoa powder until smooth.
  2. Add the peanut butter, coconut oil, sugar-free maple syrup, vanilla extract, and salt to the saucepan. Stir until well combined and smooth.
  3. Line a square baking dish with parchment paper and pour the fudge mixture into it. Smooth the top with a spatula.
  4. Sprinkle the chopped nuts on top if desired, gently pressing them into the fudge.
  5. Place the baking dish in the refrigerator and let the fudge set for at least 2 hours.
  6. Once set, remove the fudge from the baking dish and cut into small squares.
  7. Store the fudge in an airtight container in the refrigerator for up to a week.

This fudge recipe is a great alternative for diabetics who want to satisfy their sweet tooth without compromising their health. The use of unsweetened almond milk, cocoa powder, and sugar-free maple syrup helps to keep the sugar content low. Additionally, the natural peanut butter adds a creamy texture and healthy fats.

Remember, moderation is key when it comes to enjoying any sweet treat, even if it's diabetes-friendly. It's important to consult with your healthcare provider or a registered dietitian before making any significant changes to your diet. They can provide personalized guidance and ensure that this fudge recipe fits into your overall meal plan.

So, go ahead and indulge in this guilt-free fudge recipe. Enjoy the rich chocolatey flavor without worrying about your blood sugar levels.
